alert.note: Alert for Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:46AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellowjacket Creek at Hammett Rd below Hogansville affecting Troup County. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Suwanee, Buford, Buford, Suwanee, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Roswell, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairburn, Fairplay, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Corinth, Franklin, West Point, Union, Columbus, Omaha...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yellowjacket Creek at Hammett Rd below Hogansville. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flooding begins of the marshy wetlands and woods along the creek upstream and downstream from the stream gage on the Hammett Road bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EST Wednesday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 04/09/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this evening at 600 PM EST.
